pred_item.label: Fevipiprant 150 mg
pred_item.description: Patients received fevipiprant 150 mg once daily (o.d.) added to standard of care (SoC) asthma therapy.

pred_item.label: Fevipiprant 450 mg
pred_item.description: Patients received fevipiprant 450 mg once daily (o.d.) added to standard of care (SoC) asthma therapy.

pred_item.label: Placebo
pred_item.description: Patients received matching placebo once daily (o.d.) added to standard of care (SoC) asthma therapy.

ref_item.name: QAW039 150 mg
ref_item.description: One tablet of QAW039 150 mg once daily

pred_item.name: Standard of Care
pred_item.description: Existing asthma therapy according to GINA guidelines (Steps 3, 4, and 5).

ref_item.name: QAW039 450 mg
ref_item.description: One tablet of QAW039 450 mg once daily

pred_item.name: Fevipiprant
pred_item.description: An oral, non-steroidal, highly selective, reversible antagonist of the DP2 receptor administered at doses of 150 mg or 450 mg.

ref_item.name: Placebo
ref_item.description: One tablet of Placebo once daily

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) up to Week 52 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Adverse events starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +7 days (30 days in the case of a serious AE) were classified as treatment emergent AEs. For this Outcome Measure, AE up to week 52 are reported.

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) up to Week 156 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Adverse events starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +7 days (30 days in the case of a serious AE) were classified as treatment emergent AEs

pred_item.description: AEs (including asthma exacerbations), starting on or after the time of the first intake of study drug and until the day after the last intake of study drug were classified as treatment emergent.
pred_item.timeFrame: From first dose up to 52 weeks (Period 1) and optional 104 weeks (Period 2)

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) up to Week 52 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Serious Adverse events starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +30 days were classified as treatment emergent SAEs. For this Outcome Measure, AE up to week 52 are reported.

pred_item.measure: Time-to-first treatment emergent serious adverse event (SAE)
pred_item.description: Assessment of serious adverse events starting on or after the time of the first intake of study drug and until the day after the last intake of study drug.
pred_item.timeFrame: From first dose up to 52 weeks (Period 1) and optional 104 weeks (Period 2)

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) up to Week 156 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Serious Adverse events starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +30 days were classified as treatment emergent SAEs.

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent AEs Leading to Discontinuation From Study Treatment up to Week 52 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Adverse events leading to study treatment discontinuation starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +7 days (30 days in the case of a serious AE) were classified as treatment emergent AEs leading to study treatment discontinuation. For this Outcome Measure, AE up to week 52 are reported.

pred_item.measure: Time-to-first AE leading to discontinuation from study treatment
pred_item.description: Assessment of adverse events leading to study treatment discontinuation starting on or after the time of the first intake of study drug and until the day after the last intake of study drug.
pred_item.timeFrame: From first dose up to 52 weeks (Period 1) and optional 104 weeks (Period 2)

ref_item.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent AEs Leading to Discontinuation From Study Treatment up to Week 156 - Cox Regression Model
ref_item.description: Adverse events leading to study treatment discontinuation starting on or after the day of the first intake of study drug in this study and until the day of last intake of study drug +7 days (30 days in the case of a serious AE) were classified as treatment emergent AEs leading to study treatment discontinuation
